Package info.kgeorgiy.ja.kurkin.implementor

Class Implementor

java.lang.Object
info.kgeorgiy.ja.kurkin.implementor.Implementor
All Implemented Interfaces:
info.kgeorgiy.java.advanced.implementor.Impler, info.kgeorgiy.java.advanced.implementor.JarImpler
public class Implementor extends Object implements info.kgeorgiy.java.advanced.implementor.JarImpler
This class implementing JarImpler Allows you to use public methods to generate a class by interface

  • Method Details

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      сhecks the correctness of input arguments, all arguments must not be null
      Parameters:
      args -
      1) when running with -jar arguments, the class name is a file.jar he generated .jar file with the implementation of the corresponding class (interface).
      2)Command line argument: The full name of the class/interface to generate an implementation for. As a result of the work, the java code of the class with the Impl suffix should be generated, extending (implementing) the specified class (interface).
      See Also:
      • implement(java.lang.Class<?>, java.nio.file.Path)
      • implementJar(java.lang.Class<?>, java.nio.file.Path)

    • writingPackage

      private static String writingPackage(Class<?> token)
      Returns the fully qualified package name. If this class is a top level class, then this method returns the fully qualified name of the package that the class is a member of, or the empty string if the class is in an unnamed package.
      Parameters:
      token - token given Class to implement
      Returns:
      String representing package of generated class

    • writingNameClass

      private static String writingNameClass(Class<?> token)
      the class name is generated + "Impl"
      Parameters:
      token - token token given Class to implement
      Returns:
      String returns the part of the path that contains '/' + the name of the interface name that came to the input + "Impl.java"

    • inceptionClass

      private static StringBuilder inceptionClass(Class<?> token)
      Writes to the StringBuilder the name of the package in which the generated one lies, if there is no package, then writes "", inserts an empty string and writes to the StringBuilder the beginning of the class
      Parameters:
      token - token token given Class to implement
      Returns:
      StringBuilder consisting of package + name of package + '\n + access modifier, file name and "{"
